intro: Escobaria sneedii subsp. sandbergii, commonly known as Sandberg's liveforever, is a succulent perennial native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and clusters of small, blue-green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in the spring, which are typically arranged in a dense, compact inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and rocky environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
